intro: Froelichia lanata f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered froelichia, is a rare and ornamental plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, soft, woolly leaves and showy, white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is native to specific regions in South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for garden cultivation in warm climates. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is often sought after by horticulturists and botanical enthusiasts.
